line_2: Alas! for him who droops like me,

line_1: And all the glow of beaming sympathy;
line_2: That speaks no more to the fond meeting eye

line_1: And all the glow of beaming sympathy;
line_2: Enchanting tales of love, and tenderness, and joy.
Behold her! — dim each sorrowing eye —

line_1: A guileless bosom, true to sympathy!
line_2: How glows the joyous parent to descry
All gay and lively tho' she be,
Its page of woe to pity's eye.

line_1: Or pay thee for thy song with such sad sympathy?
line_2: Whoe'er can feel thy misery like me,
